section: The Joint Venturers recognize that both of the Joint Venturers are and will continue to be engaged in the conduct of their respective businesses for their own account. Neither Participant shall be entitled to compensation for services rendered to the Joint Venture as such, but each Investor shall be reimbursed for all direct expenses, including travel, office, and all other out-of-pocket expenses incurred in the operation of the affairs of the Joint Venture and the promotion of its businesses.
explanation: The terms "Joint Venturers", "Participant", and "Investor" are used seemingly interchangeably without clear definitions, potentially leading to confusion. It's unclear if 'Participant' and 'Investor' are meant to specifically refer to one party or both, creating ambiguity in determining who is entitled to reimbursement.

section: The Founders shall maintain adequate books and records to be kept of all the Joint Venture activities and affairs conducted pursuant to the terms of this Agreement. All direct costs and expenses, which shall include any insurance costs in connection with the distribution of the Goods or operations of the Partnership, or if the business of the Syndicate requires additional office facilities than those now presently maintained by each Owner, such item shall be paid by the Joint Venture.
explanation: This section contains several misaligned terms. It begins by referencing "Founders," which is undefined in the agreement. It then refers to the "Partnership" and "Syndicate," neither of which are defined or consistent with the stated structure of a joint venture. Finally, it mentions "Owner", which is also not defined anywhere in the document. This creates ambiguity and in-text contradictions as to who is responsible for what.

section: The Joint Venture shall commence on the 1st of March, 2003, and shall be effective until February 28, 2004 unless extended by written agreement of the Joint Venturers not less than thirty (30) days prior to scheduled termination.
explanation: The section stipulates the Joint Venture's term but fails to explicitly outline the procedure for extending the agreement. While it mentions a written agreement is necessary, it doesn't detail the specific steps, notification requirements, or the form this extension agreement should take. It simply mentions that the extension has to be done 30 days before the termination date of February 28, 2004.
